title: Exodus Chapter 40 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Exodus chapter 40 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Exodus Chapter 40 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Exodus Chapter 40.

questions.question: On which day and month did the LORD command Moses to set up the tabernacle?
options: First day of the first month
Tenth day of the second month
First day of the third month
Fifteenth day of the first month
questions.correctAnswer: First day of the first month
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:2 states that the tabernacle was to be set up on the first day of the first month.

questions.question: What was placed inside the tabernacle and covered with a veil?
options: The ark of the testimony
The altar of burnt offering
The laver
The table of shewbread
questions.correctAnswer: The ark of the testimony
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:3 says the ark of the testimony was put in the tabernacle and covered with the veil.

questions.question: Where was the altar of burnt offering placed according to Exodus 40?
options: Before the door of the tabernacle
Inside the holy place
Next to the laver
Behind the altar of incense
questions.correctAnswer: Before the door of the tabernacle
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:6 states the altar of burnt offering was set before the door of the tabernacle.

questions.question: What did Moses anoint to sanctify and make holy?
options: The tabernacle and all vessels, the altar, and the laver
Only the altar of burnt offering
Only Aaron and his sons
The cloud above the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: The tabernacle and all vessels, the altar, and the laver
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:9-11 describe anointing the tabernacle, altar, and laver to sanctify them.

questions.question: Who was brought to the door of the tabernacle to be washed with water?
options: Aaron and his sons
Moses and the elders
The Levites
All the children of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron and his sons
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:12 specifies that Aaron and his sons were brought to be washed at the door of the tabernacle.

questions.question: What garments were put upon Aaron before anointing him?
options: The holy garments
Simple robes
Common clothes
Armor of gold
questions.correctAnswer: The holy garments
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:13 states that Aaron was clothed with holy garments before being anointed.

questions.question: According to Exodus 40, what was the purpose of the anointing of Aaron and his sons?
options: That they may minister in the priest's office
That they may lead the Israelites in battle
That they may build the tabernacle
That they may teach the law
questions.correctAnswer: That they may minister in the priest's office
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:13-15 explains the anointing was so Aaron and his sons could minister as priests.

questions.question: When was the tabernacle reared up?
options: First day of the first month, second year
Tenth day of the first month, first year
Fifteenth day of the second month, second year
First day of the third month, first year
questions.correctAnswer: First day of the first month, second year
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:17 states the tabernacle was set up on the first day of the first month in the second year.

questions.question: Where was the table placed inside the tabernacle?
options: On the north side without the veil
On the south side behind the veil
In the courtyard
Near the altar of burnt offering
questions.correctAnswer: On the north side without the veil
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:22 says the table was put on the north side of the tabernacle without the veil.

questions.question: True or False: Moses was able to enter the tent of the congregation after the cloud covered it.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:35 states Moses could not enter the tent because the cloud and the glory of the LORD filled it.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Israel would journey only when the cloud lifted from the tabernacle.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:36-37 explains that Israel traveled only when the cloud lifted from the tabernacle.

questions.question: True or False: Fire was seen on the tabernacle by night as a sign of the LORD’s presence.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:38 mentions fire was on the tabernacle by night, showing the LORD's presence.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Exodus 40:27: 'And he burnt sweet ______ thereon; as the LORD commanded Moses.'
options: incense
oil
bread
sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: incense
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:27 states that sweet incense was burnt on the golden altar.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Exodus 40:31: 'And Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their ______ thereat.'
options: feet
faces
heads
arms
questions.correctAnswer: feet
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:31 specifies washing of hands and feet by Moses, Aaron, and his sons.

questions.question: What covered the tent of the congregation when the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle?
options: A cloud
A pillar of fire
A thick smoke
A bright light
questions.correctAnswer: A cloud
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:34 states that a cloud covered the tent when the glory of the LORD filled it.

medium.title: Exodus Chapter 40 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Exodus Chapter 40 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Exodus 40 teach us about obedience to God's commands in our spiritual duties?
options: By showing Moses carefully following each instruction from the LORD about setting up the tabernacle
By describing how the Israelites ignored God's instructions and faced consequences
By encouraging followers to create their own ways of worship
By showing the priests disobeying God's commands
questions.correctAnswer: By showing Moses carefully following each instruction from the LORD about setting up the tabernacle
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:16 states that Moses did all according to the LORD's command. Verses 1-15 describe detailed instructions given by God, and verses 17-33 describe Moses' obedience in following them exactly, exemplifying faithful obedience.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to trust God's timing in their life. Based on Exodus 40, what biblical truth would you share?
options: God's presence and guidance come in His perfect timing, as shown when the tabernacle was set up on the first day of the first month in the second year
God always acts immediately when we pray
We must force God's hand by acting quickly
Timing is not important in spiritual matters
questions.correctAnswer: God's presence and guidance come in His perfect timing, as shown when the tabernacle was set up on the first day of the first month in the second year
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:17 records the tabernacle was reared up on the first day of the first month in the second year, showing God’s appointed timing. Verses 36-38 further illustrate how Israel moved only when the cloud lifted, teaching trust in God’s timing.

questions.question: What does the anointing of Aaron and his sons teach us about spiritual leadership and service?
options: Spiritual leaders are set apart by God to serve and minister faithfully throughout generations
Leadership is based on personal ambition
Anointing is optional for spiritual service
Only Aaron was anointed, not his sons
questions.correctAnswer: Spiritual leaders are set apart by God to serve and minister faithfully throughout generations
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:13-15 explains Aaron and his sons were anointed and sanctified to minister to God, establishing an everlasting priesthood. This teaches the importance of being set apart and faithful in spiritual service.

questions.question: How does the detailed setup of the tabernacle in Exodus 40 illustrate the importance of order and reverence in worship?
options: The precise arrangement of furniture and vessels shows reverence and respect for God's holiness
Worship can be casual and unstructured
The tabernacle was not important to the Israelites
God accepts any form of worship regardless of order
questions.correctAnswer: The precise arrangement of furniture and vessels shows reverence and respect for God's holiness
questions.explanation: Verses 3-26 describe the exact placement of the ark, table, candlestick, altars, and laver as commanded by God. This ordered setup underscores reverence and holiness in worship practices, teaching us to approach God with respect.

questions.question: A believer asks how to maintain spiritual purity in daily life. What lesson from Exodus 40 would you share?
options: Regular cleansing and dedication, as shown by the washing of Aaron and his sons before ministering
Spiritual purity is unimportant
Only priests need to be pure
Purity comes from external rituals only
questions.correctAnswer: Regular cleansing and dedication, as shown by the washing of Aaron and his sons before ministering
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:12 and 31-32 describe washing Aaron and his sons and their hands and feet before entering the tabernacle or approaching the altar, symbolizing the importance of cleansing to maintain purity in service to God.

questions.question: How does the presence of the cloud and fire over the tabernacle teach us about God's guidance in life?
options: God visibly directs and leads His people, and they must wait for His signal before moving forward
God's guidance is hidden and unpredictable
People should act independently without waiting for God
The cloud and fire were just decorations
questions.correctAnswer: God visibly directs and leads His people, and they must wait for His signal before moving forward
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:36-38 shows the Israelites followed the cloud and fire as signs of God's presence and only journeyed when the cloud lifted, teaching reliance on God's guidance and patience.

questions.question: What can we learn about stewardship and dedication of resources from the setting up of the altar of burnt offering?
options: Dedicated use of resources and offerings honors God, as the altar was set at the tabernacle door for sacrifices
Offerings are unimportant
Resources should be used for personal gain
The altar was rarely used
questions.correctAnswer: Dedicated use of resources and offerings honors God, as the altar was set at the tabernacle door for sacrifices
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:6, 29 describe placing the altar of burnt offering and offering sacrifices as commanded, teaching that offering God our best and managing resources for His service is important.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 40, Moses was able to enter the tent of the congregation immediately after the tabernacle was set up.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:35 states Moses was not able to enter the tent because the cloud and glory of the LORD filled it, demonstrating reverence and the holiness of God's presence.

questions.question: True or False: The anointing oil was used only to anoint the priests but not the tabernacle or its vessels.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:9-11 shows the anointing oil was used to anoint the tabernacle, all vessels, the altar of burnt offering, and the laver, as well as Aaron and his sons, signifying consecration of all for holy use.

questions.question: A believer is facing discouragement in serving others in the church. What encouragement from Exodus 40 would you share?
options: Faithful service is an everlasting calling, just as Aaron’s priesthood was established for generations
Service is optional and temporary
Only certain people are called to serve
Service is a burden to be avoided
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful service is an everlasting calling, just as Aaron’s priesthood was established for generations
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:15 affirms Aaron’s anointing and priesthood are everlasting through his descendants, highlighting the value and honor in faithful, ongoing ministry.

questions.question: How does Exodus 40 encourage humility and gratitude in approaching God’s presence?
options: Moses could not enter the tabernacle because of God’s overwhelming glory, teaching reverence and humility
Moses entered boldly without fear
God’s presence is ordinary and easy to approach
Humility is not necessary before God
questions.correctAnswer: Moses could not enter the tabernacle because of God’s overwhelming glory, teaching reverence and humility
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:35 records Moses was unable to enter because the cloud and glory filled the tabernacle, reminding us to approach God with humility and gratitude for His holiness.

questions.question: What does the practice of lighting the lamps teach us about spiritual discipline and devotion?
options: Keeping the lamps burning symbolizes ongoing devotion and spiritual vigilance
Lamps were only decorative
Spiritual discipline is unnecessary
Lights were lit only once
questions.correctAnswer: Keeping the lamps burning symbolizes ongoing devotion and spiritual vigilance
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:4, 24-25 describe placing and lighting the candlestick lamps before the LORD, indicating continuous spiritual devotion and the importance of persevering in faith.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Exodus 40, the cloud and fire of the LORD were visible to all the house of Israel throughout their _______.
options: journeys
celebrations
prayers
offerings
questions.correctAnswer: journeys
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:38 states the cloud by day and fire by night were visible to all Israel throughout all their journeys, demonstrating God’s continual presence.

questions.question: How does setting up the court around the tabernacle encourage fellowship and community in church life?
options: The court created a dedicated space for the congregation to gather and worship together
The court was a private area for priests only
The court separated people from God
No communal aspect is mentioned
questions.correctAnswer: The court created a dedicated space for the congregation to gather and worship together
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:8, 33 describe setting up the court and its gate hangings, establishing a place for the community to assemble, fostering fellowship and shared worship.

questions.question: What biblical truth about perseverance through trials can be learned from the Israelites’ experience with the cloud over the tabernacle?
options: Trusting God's leading and waiting patiently even when progress is delayed
Giving up when God does not move immediately
Ignoring God’s guidance
Moving forward without God’s signal
questions.correctAnswer: Trusting God's leading and waiting patiently even when progress is delayed
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:37 shows Israel did not journey until the cloud lifted, teaching perseverance and trust in God’s timing through uncertain or difficult periods.

hard.title: Exodus Chapter 40 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Exodus Chapter 40.

questions.question: On what specific day was Moses instructed to set up the tabernacle according to Exodus 40?
options: The first day of the first month
The tenth day of the first month
The first day of the seventh month
The tenth day of the seventh month
questions.correctAnswer: The first day of the first month
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:2 explicitly states that the tabernacle was to be set up on the first day of the first month, marking the beginning of the liturgical year for Israel.

questions.question: Which sacred object was placed inside the tabernacle and covered with a veil as part of the initial setup?
options: The ark of the testimony
The golden altar
The laver
The table of showbread
questions.correctAnswer: The ark of the testimony
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:3 states that the ark of the testimony was put inside the tabernacle and covered with a veil, indicating its central sacred importance as the place of God's covenant presence.

questions.question: What was the purpose of the altar of burnt offering placed before the door of the tabernacle?
options: To offer burnt and meat offerings
To burn incense
To hold the holy oil
To serve as a washing station
questions.correctAnswer: To offer burnt and meat offerings
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:29 describes the altar of burnt offering as the place where burnt offerings and meat offerings were presented, signifying atonement and consecration.

questions.question: According to Exodus 40, which item was placed between the altar and the tent of the congregation and was filled with water?
options: The laver
The golden altar
The table of showbread
The ark of the testimony
questions.correctAnswer: The laver
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:7 and 40:30 specify that the laver was set between the altar and the tent and was filled with water for the priests to wash their hands and feet before ministering.

questions.question: What was the significance of anointing Aaron and his sons with oil as described in Exodus 40?
options: To sanctify them for the priest's office and establish an everlasting priesthood
To purify them from sin
To heal them from illness
To mark them as kings over Israel
questions.correctAnswer: To sanctify them for the priest's office and establish an everlasting priesthood
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:13-15 explain that Aaron and his sons were anointed to sanctify them for priestly ministry, establishing a perpetual priesthood through their generations, foreshadowing eternal priesthood themes in Hebrews.

questions.question: True or False: Moses was able to enter the tent of meeting immediately after the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:35 states Moses could not enter the tent because the cloud and glory of the LORD filled it, indicating God's overwhelming presence and holiness.

questions.question: How does the cloud covering the tabernacle in Exodus 40:34-38 function as a divine sign for Israel?
options: It signaled when Israel was to journey or encamp
It provided shade from the sun
It symbolized the presence of the enemy
It marked the location of the priests’ quarters
questions.correctAnswer: It signaled when Israel was to journey or encamp
questions.explanation: Verses 36-37 explain that the cloud's presence directed Israel’s movements, a typological foreshadowing of guidance by the Spirit in later biblical themes.

questions.question: Which parallelism can be observed in the description of the tabernacle's setup in Exodus 40:18-19?
options: The rearing of the tabernacle and spreading of the tent covering
The building of the altar and the anointing of Aaron
The lighting of the lamps and the offering of incense
The washing in the laver and the setting of the court gate
questions.correctAnswer: The rearing of the tabernacle and spreading of the tent covering
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:18-19 show parallel actions: erecting the structural boards and bars, then spreading the tent covering, reflecting a chiastic literary structure emphasizing order and completeness.

questions.question: What literary device is primarily used in Exodus 40:9-11 when detailing the anointing and sanctifying of the tabernacle and its vessels?
options: Parallelism
Metaphor
Allegory
Simile
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: Verses 9 to 11 use parallel structure to emphasize the sanctification of the tabernacle, altar, and laver, highlighting their holiness through repetitive phrasing.

questions.question: Which New Testament passage most directly connects to the theme of the tabernacle being filled with God's glory as in Exodus 40:34?
options: John 1:14, where the Word becomes flesh and dwells among us
Acts 2:1, the coming of the Holy Spirit
Romans 8:9, the Spirit of God dwelling in believers
Hebrews 9:11-12, the high priest entering the holy of holies
questions.correctAnswer: John 1:14, where the Word becomes flesh and dwells among us
questions.explanation: John 1:14 uses the Greek term 'dwelt' (literally 'tabernacled') among us, paralleling Exodus 40's theme of God's presence filling the tabernacle, highlighting the incarnation as God dwelling with humanity.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The laver was set between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and was filled with ______ for washing.
options: water
oil
wine
milk
questions.correctAnswer: water
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:7 and 40:30 clearly indicate that the laver was filled with water for the priests’ ritual washing, symbolizing purity.

questions.question: What cultural significance does the anointing oil used to sanctify the tabernacle and priests in Exodus 40 have in the ancient Near East?
options: It represented divine approval and consecration
It was primarily used for medicinal purposes
It symbolized wealth and status only
It was a common cosmetic with no religious meaning
questions.correctAnswer: It represented divine approval and consecration
questions.explanation: Anointing oil in the ancient Near East, as in Exodus 40:9-15, symbolized God's selection and sanctification, a practice also reflected in anointing kings and priests elsewhere in Scripture (1 Samuel 16:13).

questions.question: Which element in Exodus 40 foreshadows the New Testament concept of Jesus as the eternal High Priest?
options: The everlasting priesthood of Aaron’s descendants
The burning of incense on the golden altar
The lighting of the lamps on the candlestick
The setting of the table with bread
questions.correctAnswer: The everlasting priesthood of Aaron’s descendants
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:15 states the anointing of Aaron’s sons establishes an everlasting priesthood, which foreshadows Christ's eternal priesthood described in Hebrews 7.

questions.question: True or False: The cloud that covered the tabernacle was visible only at night according to Exodus 40.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:38 states the cloud was visible by day and fire by night, demonstrating God's continual presence among Israel.

questions.question: What is the significance of the order in which Moses sets up the tabernacle and its furnishings as described in Exodus 40?
options: It reflects a deliberate liturgical structure emphasizing holiness and separation
It was arbitrary and based on convenience
It follows the pattern of Egyptian temple constructions
It was designed to be portable with no theological meaning
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects a deliberate liturgical structure emphasizing holiness and separation
questions.explanation: The detailed sequence in Exodus 40 highlights a divinely ordained order that establishes sacred space and ritual purity, foundational for Israel's covenant relationship with God.

theological.title: Exodus Chapter 40 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Exodus Chapter 40 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What significant event took place on the first day of the first month in the second year according to Exodus 40?
options: The tabernacle was reared up
The Ark of the Covenant was made
The Ten Commandments were given
The Israelites crossed the Red Sea
questions.correctAnswer: The tabernacle was reared up
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:17 states that on the first day of the first month in the second year, the tabernacle was reared up. This event signifies the establishment of God's dwelling place among His people, aligning with God's promise to be present with Israel (Exodus 25:8; Leviticus 26:11-12; John 1:14; Hebrews 8:5).

questions.question: According to Exodus 40, what was Moses commanded to anoint and sanctify to make them holy?
options: The tabernacle, all vessels, the altar of burnt offering, and the laver
The ark of the covenant only
The priests only
The land of Canaan
questions.correctAnswer: The tabernacle, all vessels, the altar of burnt offering, and the laver
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:9-11 commands Moses to anoint and sanctify the tabernacle, all vessels, the altar of burnt offering, and the laver, making them holy. This demonstrates God's requirement for holiness in His dwelling and worship (1 Samuel 16:13; Psalm 24:3-4; Hebrews 9:23; 1 Peter 1:15-16).

questions.question: What was placed inside the ark of the testimony when Moses set up the tabernacle?
options: The testimony (the tablets of the covenant)
The golden lampstand
The manna from the wilderness
The altar of incense
questions.correctAnswer: The testimony (the tablets of the covenant)
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:20 describes Moses placing the testimony, which refers to the tablets of the covenant, inside the ark. This signifies God's covenant relationship with Israel, prefiguring Christ as the mediator of the new covenant (Deuteronomy 10:1-5; Hebrews 9:4; 2 Corinthians 3:3; Jeremiah 31:31-33).

questions.question: What was the purpose of anointing Aaron and his sons according to Exodus 40?
options: So they may minister in the priest's office as an everlasting priesthood
To make them kings of Israel
To send them as prophets to Egypt
To separate them as Levites for general service
questions.correctAnswer: So they may minister in the priest's office as an everlasting priesthood
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:13-15 explains that Aaron and his sons were anointed to minister in the priest's office, establishing an everlasting priesthood. This points to the doctrine of the priesthood and foreshadows Christ's eternal priesthood (Psalm 110:4; Hebrews 7:23-28; 1 Peter 2:9; Revelation 1:6).

questions.question: Where was the altar of burnt offering placed in relation to the tabernacle according to Exodus 40?
options: Before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation
Inside the Holy Place
On the roof of the tabernacle
Behind the altar of incense
questions.correctAnswer: Before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:6 and 40:29 state that the altar of burnt offering was placed before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation. This altar symbolizes the place of sacrifice for atonement, pointing to Christ’s sacrifice (Leviticus 1:3; Hebrews 13:10-12; Romans 3:25; 1 John 2:2).

questions.question: What happened when the cloud covered the tent of the congregation, according to Exodus 40?
options: The glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle and Moses could not enter
The Israelites immediately left for Canaan
The priests stopped their ministry
The cloud disappeared and the sun shone
questions.correctAnswer: The glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle and Moses could not enter
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:34-35 recount that when the cloud covered the tent, the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle, and Moses was not able to enter. This demonstrates God's holy presence and majesty, similar to His presence at Sinai and the fulfillment in the New Testament (Exodus 24:15-18; Isaiah 6:1-5; Luke 2:9; Revelation 21:23).

questions.question: How did the Israelites know when to journey and when to stay according to Exodus 40?
options: They journeyed when the cloud was taken up and stayed when it remained
They journeyed daily without regard to the cloud
They waited for the priests to give a signal
They journeyed only on the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: They journeyed when the cloud was taken up and stayed when it remained
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:36-37 explains that the Israelites journeyed when the cloud was lifted and remained when the cloud stayed. This symbolizes God's guidance and providence, foreshadowing the Spirit's guidance in the New Testament (Psalm 32:8; John 16:13; Galatians 5:16; Hebrews 13:5-6).

questions.question: What was the significance of lighting the lamps on the candlestick in the tabernacle?
options: To provide light before the LORD as commanded
To symbolize the sun and moon
To attract animals to the tabernacle
To dry the offerings
questions.correctAnswer: To provide light before the LORD as commanded
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:24-25 records that Moses set the candlestick and lighted the lamps before the LORD as commanded. The lampstand represents God's light illuminating His people, fulfilled in Christ as the Light of the world (Psalm 18:28; Isaiah 60:1; John 8:12; Revelation 21:23).

questions.question: What was the role of the laver placed between the tabernacle and the altar?
options: To provide water for washing hands and feet before entering the tabernacle
To hold the anointing oil
To burn incense
To store manna
questions.correctAnswer: To provide water for washing hands and feet before entering the tabernacle
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:7 and 40:30-32 indicate the laver was placed for washing with water, symbolizing purification before approaching God, which points to the need for holiness and cleansing through Christ (Psalm 24:3-4; Ephesians 5:26; Hebrews 10:22; 1 John 1:7).

questions.question: How does the cloud and fire over the tabernacle reveal God's attributes according to Exodus 40?
options: They reveal God's presence, guidance, holiness, and glory
They are natural phenomena without spiritual meaning
They show God's anger only
They indicate the tabernacle was unsafe
questions.correctAnswer: They reveal God's presence, guidance, holiness, and glory
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:34-38 shows the cloud and fire symbolize God's presence and guidance, reflecting His holiness and glory. This corresponds with other biblical passages demonstrating God's immanence and transcendence (Exodus 13:21; Psalm 97:2; Isaiah 6:3; John 1:14).

questions.question: What does the anointing of the altar of burnt offering and all its vessels signify in Exodus 40?
options: Sanctification and consecration for holy use
Decoration for beauty
Ordinary usage without special status
A reminder to the priests to clean it daily
questions.correctAnswer: Sanctification and consecration for holy use
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:10 commands anointing the altar and vessels to sanctify them, setting them apart for sacred use. This prefigures Christ’s holy sacrifice and the believer’s call to holiness (Leviticus 8:10-12; Hebrews 9:11-14; 1 Thessalonians 5:23; 2 Timothy 2:21).

questions.question: What role does Exodus 40 attribute to Moses in the setting up of the tabernacle?
options: He did all according to the LORD's command
He designed the tabernacle himself
He delegated all tasks without direct involvement
He questioned the LORD's instructions
questions.correctAnswer: He did all according to the LORD's command
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:16 states Moses acted according to all the LORD commanded, emphasizing obedience to divine revelation, illustrating faithful leadership and submission to God's will (Deuteronomy 34:5; Numbers 12:7; Hebrews 11:24-27; Philippians 2:8).

questions.question: What theological truth is illustrated by the perpetual priesthood established by Aaron and his sons in Exodus 40?
options: The continuity of mediation between God and man
The end of all priestly roles
The priesthood of the entire nation
The abolishment of sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: The continuity of mediation between God and man
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:15 teaches an everlasting priesthood through Aaron’s lineage, pointing to the ongoing need for mediation, fulfilled supremely in Christ as the eternal High Priest (Psalm 110:4; Hebrews 7:23-28; 1 Timothy 2:5; Revelation 1:6).

questions.question: What does the bread set in order on the table in the tabernacle symbolize according to biblical theology?
options: God's provision and presence with His people
Ordinary food for daily sustenance
Royal authority over Israel
Judgment against sin
questions.correctAnswer: God's provision and presence with His people
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:22-23 describes the bread set in order, symbolizing God's continual provision and fellowship. This is fulfilled in Christ as the Bread of Life (Leviticus 24:5-9; John 6:35; Matthew 4:4; Revelation 2:17).

questions.question: Why was the veil placed before the ark of the testimony in the tabernacle?
options: To separate the holy presence of God from the people
To decorate the tabernacle
To allow free access to the ark at all times
To protect the priests from the elements
questions.correctAnswer: To separate the holy presence of God from the people
questions.explanation: Exodus 40:21 shows the veil covering the ark, symbolizing the separation between God's holiness and sinful humanity, pointing forward to Christ's tearing of the veil (Exodus 26:33; Hebrews 10:19-20; Matthew 27:51; 2 Corinthians 6:16).

questions.question: How does Exodus 40 portray the relationship between God's holiness and human access to His presence?
options: Access is mediated through sanctification, priestly ministry, and divine guidance
Anyone could enter the tabernacle at any time
God's presence was hidden and inaccessible
Access was only through sacrifices without sanctification
questions.correctAnswer: Access is mediated through sanctification, priestly ministry, and divine guidance
questions.explanation: The chapter outlines anointing, sanctifying vessels and priests, washing rites, and the cloud guiding the people (Exodus 40:9-15, 30-32, 36-38), showing God's holiness requires mediated access, fulfilled in Christ the Mediator (Leviticus 16:2; Hebrews 4:14-16; John 14:6; 1 Timothy 2:5).
